snippet: A new study suggests that predictable social lives accentuate individual quirks and personal styles in spiders that live in groups.
abstract: Dr Jonathan N Pruitt study in Proceedings of the Royal Society B reports that about 25 spider species have developed social habits and survival mechanisms, unlike majority of solitary species; researchers say that social spiders may offer fresh insight into array of human personality traits; new work on such species is part of expanding field of animal personality research, which seeks to understand reasons behind behavioral differences.
lead_paragraph: A new study suggests that predictable social lives accentuate individual quirks and personal styles in spiders that live in groups.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Proceedings of the Royal Society B (Journal)
